intro: Phyllorkis pendiphylis, commonly known as the hanging leaf plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to eastern Australia and is characterized by its pendulous, fleshy leaves that hang from the stems. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in spikes, often blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Phyllorkis pendiphylis is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique leaf structure and attractive floral display.
